title: (x) James Bond 007 "Casino Royale" movie logo - Century Gothic {Angel}
content:
Can anybody identify the font used in 007 James Bond Casino Royale?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo\_casino\_royale01.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131213070619/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_casino_royale01.jpg) | 57.12 KB |
author: eikewohlgemuth

comments.content: 007 surely customised (7 to look like handle of gun).
That's true, I forgot about that. There are few novelty fonts that have that symbol - just search for 007 on dafont.com

Naw, just go to [Brands of the World](http://web.archive.org/web/20131213070619/http:/brandsoftheworld.com/) and download [the logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20131213070619/http:/brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query_id=9827900&page=1&mtype=&brand_id=29651) there. I used it for [our new year's card](http://web.archive.org/web/20131213070619/http:/typophile.com/node/30221) and it's fine. :^)
Thanks a lot! You were right, it’s the Century Gothic. They seem to use a special version with small capitals and a modified »o«.

Somewhat OT: And for the Daniel Craig (and Colm Meaney) fans out there, as well as fans of great soundtracks, check out [Layer Cake](http://web.archive.org/web/20131213070619/http:/imdb.com/title/tt0375912/), now available on DVD....
